comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: That would be Mrs. Lawrence Cowle Phipps, wife of a US Senator from Colorado, and a steel company executive: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lawrence_C._Phipps bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=p000317 I'm guessing it's the third Mrs. Lawrence Phipps--the former Miss Margaret Rogers, daughter of former Denver Mayor Platt Rogers. They wed in January 1911. If that's Margaret Rogers Phipps (1888-1968), there's a later photo of her here: www.du.edu/phipps/history.html She was inducted into the Colorado Tennis Hall of Fame in 2000; she won the Colorado State Open women's doubles championship three times. It might also be the second Mrs. Phipps, the former Genevieve Chandler (b 1879), whose name also appeared frequently in the society pages; but that marriage was annulled in 1904.

comment.author: 34911459@N08
comment._content: pennylrichardsca: thanks for providing us additional information about Mrs. Phipps.  I think it might be Margaret Rogers after looking at her earlier and later pictures.  We will probably investigate further before making any changes to the record.
